refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Generators are small executables that live in &environmentgeneratordir;/ and other directories listed above. systemd1 will execute those binaries very early at the startup of each user manager and at configuration reload time, before the environment files described in environment.d5 are loaded. Generators can dynamically generate files to override this configuration. See environment.d5 for more details.

Generators are loaded from a set of paths determined during compilation, as listed above. Generators found in directories listed earlier override the ones with the same name in directories lower in the list. A symlink to /dev/null or an empty file can be used to mask a generator, thereby preventing it from running. Please note that the order of the two directories with the highest priority is reversed with respect to the unit load path, and generators in /run overwrite those in /etc.

After installing new generators or updating the configuration, systemctl daemon-reload may be executed. This will delete the previous configuration created by generators, re-run all generators, and cause environment configuration to be re-read. It will be used for any services that are started subsequently.
Environment file generators are executed similarly to unit file generators described in systemd.generator7, with the following differences:

Environment generators are executed sequentially, so each generator can read the configuration files written by previous generators and base its own output on it. Generators are executed in the alphanumerical order of the final component of their name. It is encouraged to use numerical prefixes for generator names to simplify ordering.

Each generator is invoked with a list of paths to directories containing environment configuration files, in order of priority. The last argument is always the directory for dynamically generated files, and each generator should write its output there, by convention using a file name matching the generator name (with the .conf extension added).
